Instruction: Combine oil in a fryer. Mix flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, and half a packet of the soft drink mix in a bowl.
Combine milk, eggs, melted butter, and vanilla extract in a separate large bowl and whisk until combined. Gradually mix in the flour mixture until a thick pancake batter consistency is achieved.
Fry spoonfuls of the batter in hot oil until deep golden brown on all sides, about 2 to 3 minutes. Transfer the fried portions to a paper towel-lined plate to drain.
Roll the doughnuts in the sugar mixture while still warm. Place them on a fresh set of paper towels to cool slightly before serving.
The nutritional value of oil for frying is based on a retention value of 10% after cooking. This can vary depending on the cooking time, temperature, ingredient density, and type of oil.
